text: Quiet and peaceful walk with minimal disturbances. Mainly boardwalk and expect some stairs that have slope by the side. Great view of the beach. Look out for birds, monitor lizard and otters!

Started the trail from ferry point. At certain point of walk (10mins walk) was closed to the public.  Couldn't find the alternative trail/ route as mentioned in the Notice sign . Have to u-turn back. ☹️ ☹️
Managed to catch otters and eagles.

The Changi Boardwalk in Singapore is a serene and picturesque coastal trail, perfect for nature lovers and those seeking a tranquil escape. Stretching along the eastern coastline, it offers stunning views of the sea, lush greenery, and a peaceful atmosphere. The boardwalk is divided into several sections, such as the Sunset Walk and the Kelong Walk, each providing a unique experience, from sunset vistas to glimpses of traditional fishing platforms. It’s an ideal spot for a leisurely stroll, photography, or simply soaking in the natural beauty. Highly recommended for a relaxing day out!
Love this place!  Been there a few times.  Planning to go again. Anyone knows if there are sections that are still closed?
Difficult to access (April 2025). All the entrances were boarded (pun intended) up.
